item.title: Ghost of Yotei Debuts to Strong Sales, Clears Huge Financial Milestone
item.description:
Ghost of Yotei has reportedly cleared 2 million sales, hitting that milestone approximately three days into its release. The figure suggests that Ghost of Yotei 's early sales are nearly on par with its predecessor, which had a record-breaking launch in 2020.

Ghost of Yotei was released on October 2. Like Ghost of Tsushima , the latest title from Sony subsidiary Sucker Punch Productions debuted as a PlayStation exclusive.

Ghost of Yotei Reportedly Already Made Over $140 Million

As of October 5, the game had reportedly passed 2 million sales. That's according to a congratulatory social media post attributed to Stephen Lin, PlayStation China's director of commercial and sales operations. Even assuming all sales were of the Standard Edition of Ghost of Yotei , priced at $69.99, that would still equate to approximately $140 million in revenue. Because it is a first-party PS5 exclusive, there are no platform fees to deduct from that figure. Actual revenue is likely higher, as PlayStation also offered $79.99 Digital Deluxe and $249.99 Collector's Editions.

Ghost of Yotei Likely Already Made Back Its Development Budget Twice Over

In a September 2025 interview with Game File's Stephen Totilo, Sucker Punch co-founder and studio head Brian Fleming said the 2025 title's budget was similar to that of Ghost of Tsushima , indicating that Ghost of Yotei cost around $60 million to make. With 2 million units sold, the game would have recouped its development budget roughly twice over by now. However, Sony’s actual profits are ostensibly still below the 100% mark, as the $60-million figure excludes marketing costs, which are likely substantial, given Ghost of Yotei ’s positioning as the company’s flagship release for Q4 2025.

Ghost of Yotei 's sales presently appear to be tracking slightly behind Ghost of Tsushima . The 2020 title cleared 2.4 million sales in its first 72 hours on the market, according to official figures shared by Sony. That performance made Ghost of Tsushima the fastest-selling first-party original IP on the PlayStation 4. Because it launched just ahead of the next console generation, there were no other first parties to realistically challenge it, which effectively secured its PS4 record for all time.

Ghost of Tsushima vs Ghost of Yotei Sales Comparison

Ghost of Tsushima (2020)

Ghost of Yotei (2025)

First 3 days

2.4 million

2 million

First 4 months

5 million

N/A

First 2 years

9.73 million

N/A

First 4 years

13 million

N/A

The lifetime sales of Ghost of Tsushima sat at 13 million as of September 2024, with Sucker Punch confirming as much in a New York Times interview. Though Ghost of Yotei 's launch appears to have been slightly weaker, the game may still achieve a similar level of long-term commercial success. Ghost of Tsushima saw a significant boost from a successful Steam release, which is estimated to have contributed over 2 million additional units to its lifetime sales tally. Although its sequel has not yet been confirmed for other platforms, Sony’s recent track record suggests a Ghost of Yotei PC version may only be a question of time.

9.8 /10
10 /10

Ghost of Yotei

item.title: Undisputed May Reset Players' Stats in Next Update
item.description:
Undisputed developer Steel City Interactive may be resetting players' fight records alongside the game's Championship Edition, which is set to launch on October 21. The development studio took to social media this week to ask fans whether they would like to see their Undisputed player record wiped clean this month, a request players have been making for some time due to the numerous issues that have been present since the game's launch.

It has been over a decade since EA released a new Fight Night game, leaving a significant gap in the market for a AAA boxing game. Steel City Interactive saw that gap and decided to fill it with Undisputed , a game that the studio says is "the most authentic boxing game to date." Unfortunately, that sentiment wasn't shared by fans of the sport. After remaining in early access for nearly two years, Undisputed launched to mixed reviews in October 2024, with fans criticizing the game's inconsistent hit detection, numerous technical issues and bugs, and overall gameplay issues.

Undisputed Asks Players if Records Should Be Reset

Steel City has attempted to rectify many of these problems with a steady stream of new updates for Undisputed . Unfortunately, one of its most severe issues had been present for quite some time, resulting in players accumulating losses on their records as opponents exploited a quitting glitch. This, among many other things, has led to fans requesting that all player records be reset. The studio has remained quiet on the matter until earlier today, when the official Undisputed Twitter account released a poll asking players if it should reset records with the launch of the Championship Edition on October 21.

The poll currently has over 1,300 votes on Twitter alone, but Steel City says it will only implement the most requested change when the poll reaches 5,000 votes across all social media platforms, such as Facebook, Discord, etc. It also seems like fans are in agreement that stats should be reset, as over 80% of the votes are in favor of the idea. Assuming that the poll does manage to accumulate the required number of votes, fans can expect the change to take place on October 21 with a new update, another Undisputed DLC, and the release of the controversial Championship Edition.

Undisputed 's Championship Edition was announced earlier this year and will come with an additional contemporary Terence Crawford (which all players will also receive), and four DLC packs. With three fighter packs already available to purchase, the fourth is being kept a secret until October 21. Unfortunately, Undisputed fans were once again unhappy with the announcement, as some even labeled Steel City's attempt at getting more money from fans as "embarrassing" due to the issues still present in the base game.

20
5.5 /10

item.title: Fortnite Leak Reveals Tron: Ares Cosmetics
item.description:
A popular Fortnite leaker has given players their first look at the upcoming collaboration between the movie Tron: Ares and Epic Games' battle royale, which includes a wide variety of cosmetics coming to the Item Shop. Fortnite is currently preparing to release its annual Halloween event, Fortnitemares, and it's rumored that gamers will be treated to several new crossovers during the month of October.

Tron: Ares is the third film in the popular science fiction franchise, which stars Jared Leto as the titular Ares. Fans can look forward to finally jumping back into the world of Tron when the film releases in theaters on October 10. The first film, Tron , was originally released in 1982. It was then followed by Tron: Legacy , which released over 25 years later in 2010. While the newest film isn't out yet, fans of the franchise have plenty of theories about Tron: Ares , especially when it comes to its connection with Tron and Tron: Legacy .

Tron: Ares Is Coming to Fortnite

In a recent post on Twitter, the prominent leaker Loolo_WRLD gave players their first look at the entire set of Tron: Ares cosmetics coming to Fortnite . From what was shared, it seems as if fans of the new film will be able to purchase a skin of Jared Leto's character, Ares. The character can be seen wearing his signature black suit with glowing red accents. The crossover will also include a glider called Jump Jet and a wrap called Out of Tron, both of which adhere to the same color scheme as Ares himself. Ares' Staff will also be available as a pickaxe alongside the Dillinger Disc, which acts as both a harvester and back bling. Players will even be able to pick up two emotes, the Portal Beam and the Lil' Light Bike.

  • Outfit - Ares (Tron)
  • Back Bling - Dillinger Disc
  • Pickaxe - Dillinger Disc
  • Pickaxe - Ares' Staff
  • Glider - Jump Jet
  • Emote - Portal Beam
  • Emote - Lil' Light Cycle
  • Wrap - Out of Tron

While the Tron: Ares cosmetics will be available separately in Fortnite 's Item Shop, they will also be offered as a bundle. However, leakers have not been able to share how much the bundle or individual items will cost when they come to the Item Shop. Leakers have claimed that gamers will be able to acquire these cosmetics as soon as October 7, though no official announcement has been made by Epic Games.

Tron: Ares isn't Fortnite 's only crossover right now, as the battle royale currently features a major collaboration with Kpop Demon Hunters . In addition to releasing three skins and a wide variety of accessories, Epic Games debuted a new Demon Rush mode for players to enjoy. Gamers can even find special items connected to Kpop Demon Hunters in the title's battle royale modes. With so much content to enjoy and even more just around the corner, many fans are feeling optimistic about the future of Fortnite .

295
8.9 /10

item.title: How to Unlock All Trophies in Silent Hill f
item.description:
Silent Hill f comes with its fair share of challenges as you jump into Hinako's shoes to unveil what plagues the idyllic town of Ebisugaoka. Many of these are unlockable in the form of trophies and achievements in the game, but without knowing exactly where to look, some of the game's collectibles, secrets, and puzzles will be difficult to find.

This guide will break down the requirements for unlocking each trophy for Silent Hill f . Note that if you are completely new to the game, the trophies will contain some potential hints and spoilers regarding other endings.

How to Unlock All Silent Hill f Trophies & Achievements

It is impossible to unlock all trophies and achievements in a single playthrough of Silent Hill f . The game features New Game+, which will unlock certain features and areas for Hinako to explore, many of which are required for trophies. For story purposes, it is also highly recommended to jump into New Game+ once players have completed their first run. Many of the game's toughest challenges will also become easier in New Game+, as Omamori and stat upgrades carry over.

Throughout this guide, references to our interactive maps will be made. Here are links to all of them to make finding the exact locations of some of these secrets easier:

  • Ebisugaoka Map
  • Middle School Map
  • Corridors Map
  • Shrine Path Map
  • Worship Hall Map
  • Main Hall Map
  • Shimizu Residence Map

Trophy (Achievement)

Description

How to Unlock

I Still Have Wings

Obtained all trophies.

Complete all other trophies in order to earn this one.

Surrounded by Fog

The baby bird takes her first steps.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

The Fox's Guidance

The fox watches over the chicken coop.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Scarecrows' Whispers

As you bask in the sun, I sink into the shadows.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Cleansed

Wash thoroughly before eating.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

On the Way to School

The little sparrow escapes with its friends, wings flapping nervously...

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Shell of the Past

What exactly have we learned?

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

The Farewell Part

You have no place in my future.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

A Dangerous Path

For whom do I tread such a treacherous path?

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Plucked Wings

Anything for you.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Parting on Good Terms

Good terms? No. I'm here to burn bridges.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Solar & Lunar Eclipse

Two portals open; doors to a secret world.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

The Path of Self-Preservation

I refuse.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

The Path of Exultation

I accept.

Unlocked during the story, cannot be missed.

Coming Home to Roost

Drown in a bottomless pit of self-doubt.

The first ending, unlocked on your first playthrough.

Fox's Wedding

Dolls are happiest when they are loved.

Requires New Game+, see this guide for all ending requirements.

The Fox Wets Its Tail

A hell of your own choosing. Nothing else matters, now.

Requires New Game+, see this guide for all ending requirements.

Ebisugaoka in Silence

We need to talk about our future.

Requires New Game+, see this guide for all ending requirements.

The Great Space Invasion!

Rise up! The Space Army is coming!

Requires New Game+, see this guide for all ending requirements.

Thankful to Be Here

Complete the game with action difficulty set to "Story" or higher.

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Story" as your action difficulty.

Grateful for a Worthy Foe

Complete the game with action difficulty set to "Hard" or higher.

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Hard" as your action difficulty.

Clear Skies

Complete the game with action difficulty set to "Lost in the Fog".

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Lost in the Fog" as your action difficulty.

Intellectual Pursuits

Complete the game with puzzle difficulty set to "Story".

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Story" as your puzzle difficulty.

Wise Researcher

Complete the game with puzzle difficulty set to "Hard".

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Hard" as your puzzle difficulty.

Puzzle Master

Complete the game with puzzle difficulty set to "Lost in the Fog".

At the start of the game, make sure to select "Lost in the Fog" as your puzzle difficulty.

Like the Fleeing Hare

Escaped the Fog Monster at Ebisugawa without getting hit.

During the first chase against the Fog Monster, avoid getting hit by the Fog Monster. Use Stamina boosting items like Higashi and the Horse Omamori (NG+) here to keep running.

Untouchable

Opened the Shrine Vault at the Shrine Path without getting hit.

In order to keep dodging and running, use a Stamina boosting item like Higashi. This will be easier to acquire in New Game+ with Horse Omamori and relevant stat upgrades.

Acupuncture Specialist

Arrived at the Nishida residence without making a single mistake on the scarecrow puzzle.

For an in-depth guide on which scarecrows are the correct ones, see this guide.

A Federal Offense

Opened the Igarashi residence's mailbox.

See this dedicated guide to know where to go.

The Sound of Silence

Defeated Sakuko without getting hit by the suzu bell attack.

Sakuko's second phase has her teleport around the arena to charge a bell attack. Interrupt her by attacking while she's charging.

Go Away! You'll Ruin the Shop's Reputation!

Defeated the Giant Monster in front of Chizuruya General Store.

Having upgrades and Omamori from New Game+ will be highly useful here. Dispatch the small ones first and then focus on the big, slow one.

No One Left Behind

Stopped a certain number of enemies behind the white rabbit crest door from reanimating.

Kill all enemies in one section (there are two to open the main door). Make sure to do this beneath the blue lanterns.

Agile Escape

Escaped the Fog Monster at Sugisato without getting hit.

Use Higashi, or keep this for your New Game+ run to have the Horse Omamori with you.

Echoes of Jealousy

Defeated Rinko without being hit by her puppets.

Puppets will dash and explode at you when they start to twitch and burn. Kite them away and keep an extra dodge while focusing on Rinko.

O Divine Tree

Discovered the Thousand Year Cedar.

After escaping the Fog Monster through a torii gate in the mountains, head up and left to an old shrine instead of Shu's house.

Just Shut Up for Once, Dad!

Defeated Hinako's father before her mother at the Shimizu residence.

Use your highest damage weapon and a Higashi to keep your Stamina up. Position yourself so that the father is between you and Hinako's mother. You can also kite the faster-moving mother to the other side and then focus on the father.

Sly Like the Fox

Obtained all the crests without making a single mistake on the Inari statue puzzle.

In the Treasure Hall, always pick the correct door in the correct order. See this guide for the exact path.

Where Are You Going?

Caught up with the Fog Monster 3 times.

Ignore all enemies you don't have to kill to proceed. The Horse Omamori and Higashi are also highly useful for any of these running sequences.

The Bird that Flies Highest

Defeated the Shiromuku without dying once.

Be cautious of the Shiromuku's area of effect attack, where it will slump down and charge up. This can wipe your health bar quickly. Otherwise, focus on timing dodges.

Fox Tamer

Defeated all the summoned monsters before putting an end to the Shichibi.

During the Shichibi boss fight, try to kite the summoned monsters away from the main boss in order to focus them down first.

Puppetmaster

Defeated the Tsukumogami without getting hit by a single arrow.

During the Tsukumogami boss fight, the boss will shoot out golden arrows. The Suzuran Omamori will help greatly with this boss fight, as it makes perfect dodges easier to hit.

God Slayer

Defeated both the Tsukumogami and the Kyubi within 10 minutes of the fight starting.

Having a few set Omamori (Tanuki and Suzuran), plenty of consumables for both bosses, and several good weapons for the Tsukumogami (knives and sickles) will be helpful.

Winners Don't Do Drugs

Reached the Iwai residence without taking a single capsule and left the capsules on Shu's desk in his workshop.

Avoid using the Red Capsules for healing and prioritize other sources like Bandages, First Aid Kits, and food items.

The Malevolent Blade Never Rusts

Obtained the Sacred Sword after uncovering its legend.

Complete the Jizo Statue puzzle, and return to the Great Cedar Tree to unlock the Sacred Sword. The Jizo Statues are scattered throughout the game.

Treasure Belonging

Obtained the small vial containing the Agura no Hotei-sama.

The item is found during a New Game+ run, when you return to the Dark Shrine, where Hinako received her special powers. The room with the broken floor is where you want to go, and use your fox sight to access a new area where the item is found.

Be Free of Your Hatred

Purified the Sacred Sword.

Complete the Crimson Water puzzle in the Dark Shrine by accessing a new area with your fox sight. This will allow you to purify the Sacred Sword when you return to the real world.

A Gift I Cannot Accept

Offered the Brooch to the ancient Jizo Statue.

When returning to your home for the last time, stop by the Jizo Statue to sacrifice your Brooch.

Close to the Sun

Fully upgraded Health, Sanity, and Stamina.

A lot of Faith and Ema are needed for full upgrades. Check the interactive maps for Ema locations, as well as offerings.

Fervent Collector

Obtained all items that increase inventory size.

Several key items can be acquired throughout the game to increase your inventory size. To find them all, check out the interactive maps for their exact locations.

Omamori Collector

Obtained all the omamori available from hokora.

These are specifically the random Omamori that can be drawn from hokora, which cost 300 Faith each to draw.

Omamori Sage

Obtained all the hidden omamori.

Various Omamori are hidden throughout the game in set spots. Check the interactive maps for their exact locations.

Inari-sama's Secrets

Opened all rooms and boxes marked with Inari-sama's seal.

These special doors and boxes are only accessible in NG+ and can only be opened with the Brooch key item. Here are the locations:

  • West part of Dark Shrine Corridors below the Inari statue.
  • Southwestern part of Worship Hall, where the interactive map shows dolls.
  • In the Main Hall, southeastern stairwell to a room with broken floor.
  • During Inari crest puzzle, after second crest, a door with a lantern appears.
  • Due west of the mask and bloody key you find in Ebisugaoka.
  • South from the Shrine Path building, where you find the stone key.
  • By the Ebisugaoka fields next to the house you can enter.
  • First floor of Middle School, the first classroom, accessible from outside.
  • Mountainpath, before you get to Shu's place, northeast of a hokora.
  • From Shu's house to Shimizu house, located before a hokora in town.
  • Shimizu residence dungeon first floor, room below photo puzzle.

The Truth about the Tsuneki Family

Obtained the following documents: Housemaid's Note, Family Physician's Log, and Strict Mother's Letter.

Note that all of these documents have multiple pieces to them, with some of them locked behind NG+. Check our interactive maps for their exact locations.

Fate of the Apostate

Obtained all the following documents: Diary of Revenge.

Note that all of these documents have multiple pieces to them, with some of them locked behind NG+. Check our interactive maps for their exact locations.

A Miko Possessed

Obtained all the following documents: Sakuko's Diary.

Note that all of these documents have multiple pieces to them, with some of them locked behind NG+. Check our interactive maps for their exact locations.

Fires of Jealousy

Obtained all the following documents: Rinko's Diary.

Note that all of these documents have multiple pieces to them, with some of them locked behind NG+. Check our interactive maps for their exact locations.

Good Intentions...

Obtained all the following documents: Clinical Trial.

Note that all of these documents have multiple pieces to them, with some of them locked behind NG+. Check our interactive maps for their exact locations.

10
9.2 /10
10 /10

Silent Hill f

item.title: Legends: Z-A Buffs and Debuffs Will Work Differently Than in Most Pokemon Games
item.description:
Moves in Pokemon Legends: Z-A that boost the stats of friendly Pokemon or lower the stats of enemy monsters will follow a different formula than the one used in mainline Pokémon games, according to a new leak. There are already some obvious differences between Pokemon Legends: Z-A and the gameplay of classic Pokemon games, but players who make heavy use of moves like Swords Dance will need to adjust their strategies to account for one deviation from the norm.

Contained inside the Kalos Region's Lumiose City, the upcoming spin-off game will place a heavy focus on Mega Evolution as it takes a finer look at some of the plot points first introduced in Pokemon X and Y. Boasting a potential roster of 232 Pokemon, there will be a lot of options for players in building their teams, but classic Pokemon players should be prepared for a few differences from the standard formula.

Pokemon Legends Z-A Stat-Adjustment Moves Won't Stack

One of these gameplay changes applies to how the game will handle the Pokemon series' collection of stat-adjusting moves, which will no longer stack as they do in mainline Pokemon games. Instead, these moves will still provide buffs and debuffs, but only for a limited amount of time, and at a constant rate until they expire. Information shared by one reliable leaker, Centro Leaks, via their Twitter account, shows a still image from a YouTube video of playtesting footage that includes an informational pop-up regarding the change. This alteration from mainline Pokemon rules will instead follow a similar formula to the one used in Legends: Z-A 's predecessor, Pokemon Legends: Arceus , whereby using stat-adjusting moves before their time limit has run out will extend their duration rather than increase their effectiveness on a per-use basis.

Some other changes to gameplay will aid players, however. Previously released information has shown changes to Mega Evolution in Pokemon Legends: Z-A that will allow players to Mega Evolve each Pokemon more than once per battle and even potentially have multiple Mega Evolutions fighting on a team at the same time. Both these changes account for the Legends series' use of real-time battling, which is a departure from the traditional turn-based structure of mainline Pokemon games.

With the revelation from nearly a week ago that some early copies of Pokemon Legends: Z-A were already in the wild, some fans have been eagerly on the lookout for leaks that could share secrets about the game, while others are desperately trying to avoid spoilers. Fortunately for the latter group, spoilers from these early copies have been relatively tame, but those wanting to dive into a fresh experience may want to stay vigilant as time creeps closer to Pokemon Legends: Z-A 's launch date on October 16.

Pokemon Legends: Z-A
